text: is a Japanese city in eastern Shikuoka Prefecture on the island of Honshū. It is near Mount Fuji. It has been recognized as a special city since 2001.Jacobs, A.J. "Japan's Evolving Nested Municipal Hierarchy: The Race for Local Power in the 2000s," Urban Studies Research (2011), Table 3; retrieved 2012-12-18. ==History== In the Edo period, was the 14th of the 53 shogunate- maintained waystations (shuku-eki) along the Tōkaidō road which connected Edo and Kyoto.Nussbaum, "Tōkaidō" at p. 973. ==Related pages== * The Fifty-three Stations of the Tōkaidō ==References== ==Other websites== * http://www.city.fuji.shizuoka.jp/hp/menu000009500/hpg000009476.htm ; Category:Cities in Shizuoka Prefecture
title: Fuji, Shizuoka
